description: Gualenghi-d'Este Hours; Taddeo Crivelli (Italian, died about 1479, active about 1451 - 1479), and Guglielmo Giraldi (Italian, active 1445 - 1489); Ferrara, Emilia-Romagna, Italy; 1469; Tempera colors, gold paint, gold leaf, and ink on parchment bound between wood boards covered with dark red morocco; Leaf: 10.8 × 7.9 cm (4 1/4 × 3 1/8 in.); Ms. Ludwig IX 13; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
